priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C181169

self.title: CDISC SDTM Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist relevant to the description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the ISTEST variable.
name: Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Binding Agent for Immunogenicity Tests Terminology

terms.definition: Antigen(s) from the seed of the species Prunus dulcis (almond) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the species Periplaneta americana (American cockroach) that are considered as insect allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the species Dermatophagoides farinae (American house dust mite) that are considered as insect allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from a mix of animals that are considered as animal allergen(s).

An antigen encoded by the BPI gene and an endogenous antibiotic, cytotoxic protein in the innate immune system. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases inflammatory bowel disease, systemic lupus erythematosus and rheumatoid arthritis.
Antigen(s) in the Hymenoptera venom from a mix of bees that are considered as insect allergen(s).
terms.preferredTerm: Multiple Bee Mix Hymenoptera venom Antigens

terms.definition: Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Cynodon dactylon (Bermuda grass) that are considered as plant allergen(s).

An antigen of the cardiolipin-binding protein encoded by the APOH gene. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases antiphospholipid syndrome and systemic rheumatic diseases like systemic lupus erythematosus.
Antigen(s) from cow milk that has been boiled, that are considered as food allergen(s).
The approximately 220-250 kDa cell surface, adhesin protein and the virulence factor for Bordetella pertussis.
A mixture of fimbriae antigens from Bordetella pertussis.
The approximately 69 kDa cell surface, autotransporter protein and the virulence factor for Bordetella pertussis.
The approximately 105 kDa secreted exotoxin and the virulence factor for Bordetella pertussis.
The approximately 18 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 23 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
synonyms: Borrelia burgdorferi Outer surface protein C

terms.definition: The approximately 28 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 30 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 39 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 41 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 45 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 58 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 66 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
The approximately 93 kDa protein encoded by the bacteria Borrelia burgdorferi which is a Lyme disease antigen.
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Acer negundo (box elder tree) that are considered as plant allergen(s).

An antigen of the diphosphatidylglycerol lipid found uniquely in the inner membrane of mitochondria. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases antiphospholipid syndrome and systemic rheumatic diseases.
Antigen(s) from the seed of the species Anacardium occidentale (cashew nut) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the dander (skin flakes) of the species Felis catus (domestic cat) that are considered as animal allergen(s).

Antigen(s) of the lysosomal proteinase or endopeptidase family and are encoded by the CTS gene. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with systemic vasculitis, inflammatory rheumatic diseases, autoimmune hepatitis, and chronic inflammatory bowel diseases.
An antigen of the centromere protein encoded by the CENPB gene, with a designation of B. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease CREST syndrome.

Antigen(s) of the centromere protein family and are encoded by the CENP gene. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases Sjogren's syndrome, systemic sclerosis, and CREST syndrome.
Antigen(s) from a mix of workplace or household chemicals that are considered as allergen(s).
The approximately 150 kDa secreted protein toxin and the virulence factor for Clostridium tetani.
The purified and detoxified form of the Clostridium tetani toxin. Toxicity of this toxin is suppressed or inactivated either by heat or with formaldehyde.
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Ambrosia artemisiifolia (common ragweed) that are considered as plant allergen(s).

An antigen of the "q" subcomponent of the C1 complement protein complex. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and severe rheumatoid arthritis.
An antigen of the cleaved "d" fragment of the C3 complement protein. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease systemic lupus erythematosus.
Antigen(s) from the fruit (i.e. kernel/maize) of the species Zea mays (corn) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the fruit of the species Corylus avellana (common hazel) that are considered as food allergen(s).
The purified and detoxified form of the Corynebacterium diphtheriae toxin. Toxicity of this toxin is suppressed or inactivated either by heat or with formaldehyde.
Antigen(s) in the dander (skin flakes) of the species Bos taurus (cow) that are considered as animal allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the milk produced by a cow that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from cow milk that has been curdled and strained, that are considered as food allergen(s).
An antigen of the citrulline-containing peptide with a cyclic structure. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease rheumatoid arthritis.
Antigen(s) in the mix of foods made from mammalian milk that are considered as food allergen(s).
The B subtype of nuclease produced by group A beta-hemolytic streptococci.

An antigen of the cell-cell adhesion protein encoded by the DSG1 gene. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with autoimmune diseases pemphigus foliaceus and pemphigus vulgaris.
An antigen of the cell-cell adhesion protein encoded by the DSG3 gene. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with autoimmune disease pemphigus vulgaris.
Antigen(s) in the dander (skin flakes) of the species Canis lupus familiaris (dog) that are considered as animal allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the clear and liquid substance around the yolk of an egg that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Plantago lanceolata (English plantain) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the fruit(s) of the species Juglans regia (English walnut) that are considered as food allergen(s).
The approximately 110 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the Epstein-Barr virus.
The approximately 46-55 kDa lytic protein from the Epstein-Barr virus and is the diffuse component of the Epstein-Barr virus-induced early antigen (EA) complex.
terms.preferredTerm: Epstein-Barr Virus Early Antigen Diffuse Component
synonyms: Epstein-Barr Virus Early Antigen Diffuse Component

terms.definition: The approximately 66 kDa DNA-binding protein with a designation nuclear antigen 1, from the 6 nuclear antigens produced by the Epstein-Barr virus.
One or more proteins from the 6 nuclear antigens (EBNA 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and/or 6) produced by the Epstein-Barr virus.
Antigen(s) from the species Dermatophagoides pteronyssinus (European house dust mite) that are considered as insect allergen(s).

A group of autoimmune substances found in the nucleus of a cell which can be extracted from the saline soluble fraction of cells, and may be comprised of (but not limited to) ribonucleoproteins, Smith antigens, Sjogren's antigens, Scl-70 and/or Jo-1 antigens.
Antigen(s) from the species Gadus morhua (Atlantic cod) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the species Blattella germanica (German cockroach) that are considered as insect allergen(s).
An antigen and alcohol-soluble fraction of gluten from wheat and other grains that is considered as a food allergen.
An antigen of the 67 kDa isoform of GAD which is encoded by the GAD1 gene. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease type 1 diabetes.
An antigen of the 65 kDa isoform of GAD which is encoded by the GAD2 gene. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease type 1 diabetes.

Any antigen(s) encoded by the GAD gene that catalyze the decarboxylation of glutamate to GABA. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases type 1 diabetes, autoimmune polyendocrine syndrome types 1 and 2, and stiff man syndrome.
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Chenopodium album (goosefoot) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollens of a mix of grasses that are considered as plant allergen(s).
The approximately 21.5 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the Hepatitis B virus.
The approximately 16-18 kDa nonstructural tolerogen that forms in-between the nucleocapsid and the lipid envelope of, and is secreted by the Hepatitis B virus.
One or more of the three structural surface proteins, small, HBsAg S (26 kDa); middle, HBsAg M (33 kDa); and large, HBsAg L (41 kDa), that form the hepatitis B viral lipid envelope.
terms.preferredTerm: Hepatitis B Virus HBsAg Surface Protein Antigen

terms.definition: The 42 amino acid synthetic peptide encoded by the putative NS4 region of the Hepatitis C virus genome.
The 16 amino acid synthetic peptide encoded by the putative NS4 region of the Hepatitis C virus genome.
The 44 amino acid synthetic peptide encoded by the putative nucleocapsid core region of the Hepatitis C virus genome.
The 266 amino acid recombinant protein encoded by the putative NS3 region of the Hepatitis C virus genome.
The nonstructural protein encoded by the putative NS5 region of the Hepatitis C virus genome.
A mixture of different species (or below the species level classifications) of the herpes simplex viruses.

An antigen in the core histone family and a subunit of the nucleosome complex, with a designation of H1. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and rheumatoid arthritis.

An antigen in the core histone family and a subunit of the nucleosome complex, with a designation of H2A. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and rheumatoid arthritis.

An antigen in the core histone family and a subunit of the nucleosome complex, with a designation of H2B. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and rheumatoid arthritis.

An antigen in the core histone family and a subunit of the nucleosome complex, with a designation of H3. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and rheumatoid arthritis.

An antigen in the core histone family and a subunit of the nucleosome complex, with a designation of H4. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and rheumatoid arthritis.

Any antigen(s) of the histone nuclear protein family. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and rheumatoid arthritis.
A mixture of different species (or below the species level classifications) of the human immunodeficiency viruses.
The approximately 120 kDa envelope glycoprotein encoded by the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 160 kDa envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 1. This precursor protein is further cleaved into the gp120 and gp41 proteins.
The approximately 40 kDa envelope glycoprotein encoded from the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 41 kDa transmembrane, envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 1. This transmembrane protein is cleaved from the precursor GP160 protein.
The approximately 18 kDa product from the GAG polyprotein encoded by the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 24 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 31 kDa integrase from the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 51 kDa protein subunit of the reverse transcriptase encoded by the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 55 kDa Gag polyprotein product encoded by the human immunodeficiency virus 1. It is a precursor protein for several proteins that form the core structure of the HIV-1 virus.
The approximately 65 kDa protein subunit of the reverse transcriptase encoded by the human immunodeficiency virus 1.
The approximately 140 kDa envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 2.
The approximately 36 kDa transmembrane, envelope glycoprotein from the human immunodeficiency virus 2.
Antigen(s) in the dander (skin flakes) of the species Equus caballus (domestic horse) that are considered as animal allergen(s).
A mixture of different species (or below the species level classifications) of the human T-cell lymphotropic viruses.

An antigen of plasma protein and encoded by the ALB gene. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and type 1 diabetes.
An antigen encoded by the INSM2 gene and regulates insulin secretion. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease type 1 diabetes.
An antigen encoded by the PTPRN gene and regulates insulin secretion. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease type 1 diabetes.
A group of autoimmune substances found in the pancreatic islet beta cells. They are commonly associated with the autoimmune disease type 1 diabetes.
A group of autoimmune substances found in the cytoplasm of pancreatic islet cells that are the target of autoantibodies. They are commonly associated with the autoimmune disease type 1 diabetes.

An antigen encoded by the HARS1 gene that regulates histidyl-transfer RNA synthesis. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases anti-synthetase syndrome, polymyositis and dermatomyositis.
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Sorghum halepense (Johnson grass) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
An antigen found in the hemolymph of the species Megathura crenulata (giant keyhole limpet) that is also considered as a food allergen.

An antigen encoded by the LTF gene that binds to iron and has antimicrobial function. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases rheumatoid vasculitis and arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, ulcerative colitis, and Crohn's disease.

An antigen in the cytochrome P450 mixed-function oxidase system and is encoded by the CYP2D6 gene, it is a major drug metabolizing enzyme. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune hepatitis.

A group of autoimmune, multienzyme complexes found within the inner and outer lining of the mitochondria that may be comprised of (but not limited to) M1 through M9 antigens. They are commonly associated with autoimmune hepatitis and primary biliary cholangitis/cirrhosis.

Antigen(s) of the inner mitochondrial membrane proteins, with a designation of M2, and may be comprised of (but not limited to) protein X, the E2 component, E1a and E1b subunits of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex (PDC). They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with autoimmune hepatitis and primary biliary cholangitis/cirrhosis.
Antigen(s) from a mix of types of sources that are considered as allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from a mix of molds that are considered as allergen(s).

An antigen encoded by the MPO gene that regulates innate immunity through hypohalous acids production. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with autoimmune systemic vasculitis diseases, cystic fibrosis, COPD and other inflammatory conditions.
A group of autoimmune substances found in the nucleus of a cell that are the target of autoantibodies.

Antigen(s) of DNA packaging complexes comprising of a strand of DNA winding around a protein core and an octamer of histones. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly and mainly associated with the autoimmune disease systemic lupus erythematosus.
Antigen(s) from a mix of edible nuts that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Olea europaea (olive tree) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Dactylis glomerata (orchard grass) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
An antigen of low density lipoprotein cholesterol that is also oxidized. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated inflammatory and autoimmune conditions.
Antigen(s) from the species Pandalus borealis (Northern shrimp) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the seed of the species Arachis hypogaea (peanut) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the seed of the species Carya illinoinensis (pecan) that are considered as food allergen(s).

An antigen of the phospholipid containing serine in the inner cell membrane. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases of antiphospholipid syndrome and systemic sclerosis.

Antigen(s) of the phosphate-containing lipids. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly and mainly associated with the autoimmune diseases antiphospholipid syndrome and systemic rheumatic diseases such as systemic lupus erythematosus.
Antigen(s) from the seed of the species Pistacia vera (pistachio) that are considered as food allergen(s).

An antigen of the protein complex comprising of platelet factor 4 and heparin. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease heparin-induced thrombocytopenia.

An antigen encoded by the PRTN3 gene that regulates extracellular matrix protein proteolysis. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune systemic vasculitis disease, Wegener's granulomatosis.

Antigen(s) of the ribonucleic acid and RNA-binding protein multienzyme complexes. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases mixed connective tissue disease, systemic rheumatic diseases, and progressive systemic sclerosis.

Antigen(s) of the three phosphoproteins, P0, P1 and P2 which are components of ribosomes. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with the autoimmune disease systemic lupus erythematosus.

An antigen of the polymerase protein complex with a designation of III, that transcribes DNA into tRNA, rRNA and small RNAs. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease systemic sclerosis.
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Kali turgidum (Russian thistle) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the species Salmo salar (Atlantic Salmon) that are considered as food allergen(s).
The approximately 45.6 kDa structural protein that forms the nucleocapsid of the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 virus (SARS-CoV-2).
The approximately 180-200 kDa transmembrane, receptor binding protein from the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 virus (SARS-CoV-2).

An antigen of the nuclear enzyme topoisomerase 1 encoded by the TOP1 gene that relaxes coiled DNA. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic sclerosis and systemic lupus erythematosus.
Antigen(s) from the seed of the species Sesamum indicum (sesame) that are considered as food allergen(s).

Antigen(s) from any member(s) of the aquatic invertebrate animal having a shell and belonging to the phylum Mollusca, the class Crustacea (phylum Arthropoda), or the phylum Echinodermata that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Betula pendula (silver birch tree) that are considered as plant allergen(s).

Antigen(s) encoded by the Ro gene and are the Sjogren's type A antigens, SSA-52 and SSA-60. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with the autoimmune disease Sjogren's Syndrome.
An autoantigen encoded by the Ro52 gene (also called the TRIM21 gene) and has a molecular weight of 52 kDa. It is associated with the autoimmune disease Sjogren's Syndrome.
An autoantigen encoded by the Ro60 gene and has a molecular weight of 60 kDa. It is associated with the autoimmune disease Sjogren's Syndrome.
An autoantigen encoded by the SSB gene. It is associated with the autoimmune disease Sjogren's Syndrome.

Antigen(s) of small nuclear ribonucleoprotein (snRNP) complexes family of U1, U2, U4, U5, and U6, which contains a single nuclear RNA (snRNA) molecule, the associated proteins, and the seven core Smith (Sm) proteins. They can be considered as autoantigens and are commonly associated with the autoimmune disease systemic lupus erythematosus.

Antigen(s) of the extractable nuclear RNA-binding proteins that may be comprised of (but not limited to) Smith B, B', N, D1, D2, D3, E, F and G. They are commonly associated with the autoimmune disease systemic lupus erythematosus.

A group of autoimmune substances found in the smooth muscles that may be comprised of (but not limited to) actin and non-actin cytoskeleton components such as vimentin, tubulin, and desmin. They are commonly associated with autoimmune hepatitis.

A soluble cytosolic liver antigen which is most frequently the 50 kDa UGA serine tRNA-associated protein complex (tRNP(Ser)Sec). It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with type 1 and 2 autoimmune hepatitis.
Antigen(s) from the seed of the species Glycine max (soybean) that are considered as food allergen(s).
The approximately 60 kDa protein that is an oxygen-labile exotoxin produced by beta-hemolytic streptococci.
An antigen encoded by the TPO gene that regulates thyroid hormones synthesis. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with autoimmune thyroid disease.
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Phleum pratense (Timothy grass) that are considered as plant allergen(s).

An antigen of the transglutaminase enzyme family and catalyzes the crosslinking of proteins with a molecular weight of approximate 78 kDa. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease celiac disease.
Antigen(s) in the pollens of a mix of trees that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the species Triticum aestivum (common wheat) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from the wheat species within the genus Triticum that are considered as food allergen(s).

An antigen of the U1 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein (snRNP) complex, which contains the U1-snRNA, the U1-associated proteins 70kDa-U1, U1A, U1C, and the seven core Smith (Sm) proteins. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune diseases systemic lupus erythematosus and mixed connective tissue disease.
The approximately 55 kDa, receptor binding B subunit of the Cholera toxin and the virulence factor for Vibrio cholerae.
Antigen(s) from the fruit(s) of the Juglans species (walnut) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollens of a mix of weeds that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Ambrosia psilostachya (Western ragweed) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Ulmus americana (white elm tree) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Quercus alba (white oak tree) that are considered as plant allergen(s).
Antigen(s) from a chicken egg (including egg white and the yolk) that are considered as food allergen(s).
Antigen(s) in the pollen of the species Leymus triticoides (wild rye grass) that are considered as plant allergen(s).

An islet beta-cell secretory membrane protein encoded by the SLC30A8 gene and regulates biosynthesis and secretion of insulin. It can be considered as an autoantigen and is commonly associated with the autoimmune disease type 1 diabetes mellitus.
